frame.name: Emotion_directed
frame.definition:
<def-root>The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an <fen>Experiencer</fen> who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a <fen>Stimulus</fen> or about a <fen>Topic</fen>. There can also be a <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the response occurs or a <fen>Reason</fen> that the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes the particular response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">Mr. Whiskers</fex> is <t>upset</t> <fex name="Stimulus">that there are no more cat treats</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t>furious</t> <fex name="Experiencer">parent</fex> stormed into the office.</ex> <ex><fex name="Experiencer">Franz</fex> gets <t>infuriated</t> <fex name="Circumstances">at the thought of his ex-wife remarried</fex>.</ex> <ex> She flashed a <t>jubilant</t> <fex name="Expressor">smile</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
<ex>Nan Ho turned, <fex name="Exp">his</fex> extreme <t>agitation</t> unnoticed by the Prince.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
<ex>I was <t>angry</t> <fex name="Topic">about the war</fex>.</ex> <ex>So tell the world, and its <t>boredom</t> <fex name="Top">about your troubles</fex> will heal you.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Stimulus
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex>Liz's <t>anger</t> <fex name="Stim">towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.</ex> <ex>The feeling the bereaved find most difficult to acknowledge is their <t>anger</t> <fex name="Stim">against the dead person</fex> for abandoning them to face the world alone.</ex> <ex>Jack Smith openly discussed his innermost <t>anguish</t> <fex name="Stim">at being one of only three England players not to kick a ball during finals</fex>.</ex> <ex>David filled her dreams; the ecstasy of their lovemaking, and the pain and <t>bewilderment</t> <fex name="Stim">of his abrupt departure</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels the emotion.
<ex>Nan Ho turned, his <fex name="Degr">extreme</fex> <t>agitation</t> unnoticed by the Prince .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Empathy_target
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Empathy_target</fen> is the individual or individuals with which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response.
<ex>I am <t>happy</t> <fex name="Empathy_target">for Sara</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
<ex>"Can I help you?" she asked, trying not to let him see the <t>amusement</t> <fex name="Exr">in her blue eyes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes a certain emotional response.
<ex>The feeling the bereaved find most difficult to acknowledge is their <t>anger</t> against the dead person <fex name="Explanation">for abandoning them to face the world alone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the condition(s) under which the <fen>Stimulus</fen> evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
<ex>One career wife spoke about her <t>exasperation</t> <fex name="Circumstances">when her husband listened to her with half an ear as he watched television</fex>.</ex> <ex>Bob is <t>infuriated</t> <fex name="Circumstances">whenever I play loud music</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
<ex><fex name = "Experiencer">Tracy</fex> was in an <t>irritated</t> <fex name="State">mood</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. <ex>The end of the film was filled with <t>jubilant</t> <fex name="Event">scenes</fex>.</ex> [Here we know that the scenes are filled with jubilant <fex name="Experiencer">Experiencers</fex>.]</def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: wanhoop.n
lexUnit.definition: dat je elke hoop op iets goeds verloren hebt

lexUnit.name: treurigheid.n
lexUnit.definition: dat iemand treurig is, een droevige stemming

lexUnit.name: droefenis.n
lexUnit.definition: vanwege iets naars, waardoor je soms moet huilen
